Row.Text: Tutorial Map
Map used exclusively for the tutorial.
Dawn of Civilization
Prerequisite knowledge for the dawn of civilization
In the beginning, the earth was without form. And void. And then the sun shone upon the sleeping earth. Into this swirling maelstrom of fire air and water, the first stirrings of life appeared.
OK
Show me how
You are dismissed
Your assistance is appreciated
Continue
Let's get started
Agreed
Very good
Tell me more
ADVISOR
As your advisor I am qualified to assist you in all matters related to ruling our civilization.[NEWLINE]If you do not require my service, you can dismiss me to attend to other matters.
Greetings My Liege! As your personal advisor, I am qualified to assist you in all matters related to ruling our civilization. I am at your service.
All great civilizations begin with a great city, and our Settlers have found an ideal location. Order them to found a new city here.
Well done! You have founded your first city. From these roots your civilization will grow to stand the test of time. Now you must nurture and protect what you have created.
Security is of great importance. There are barbaric tribes near us who want nothing more than to pillage and plunder what is ours.
Direct the production efforts of this city to train Warriors to deal with this impending threat.
Training has begun, but it will be some time before our new Warriors are ready. There are no further matters to attend to right now.

Your city is busy training Warriors for its defense, but a great civilization cannot thrive on military might alone. We have people talented in the ways of science and discovery. You should employ them in researching new technologies which will advance our civilization.

Wise decision, Your Majesty. This technology will let us better extract the riches from the earth and increase [ICON_Production] Production in our cities. I will let you know when we have finished our research.

Your Majesty, hostile Barbarians have been seen near our [ICON_Capital] Capital. If left alone they are sure to attack our people and pillage our lands. Your newly trained Warriors await your orders to attack!

Our Warriors were victorious! They fought well to defend our people against this threat. However, the Barbarians are still envious of our civilization. We should be prepared in case they return in greater force.
There are other matters, Your Excellency.
Since Warrior training is complete, it is time to assign a new production task to the city.
The lands surrounding our city could be bountiful if we develop them. We should train Builders to create improvements to the lands within our borders.
There are mysteries that await us outside our borders in the uncharted lands beyond. The only way to find out is to explore.
At the beginning of the game, your city and the lands immediately around it are revealed, but the areas beyond, represented by blank parchment, indicate parts of the world you have not yet explored.

Warrior units have a [ICON_Movement] Movement range of 2.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The blue colored indicator shown on the lands around the unit displays the furthest the selected unit can move in a single turn.

Open terrain, like Plains and Grassland, only consume 1 [ICON_Movement] Movement point, whereas more difficult terrain, like Woods and Hills, will consume 2 or more [ICON_Movement] Movement points. Move the Warrior unit to the highlighted location by right clicking.
MOVE WARRIOR
RIGHT-CLICK the highlighted location to move your Warrior.
Your Majesty, our Warriors have discovered a small Tribal Village whose inhabitants are welcoming and friendly. Shall we investigate it and send the Warriors to speak with them?

Exploring Tribal Villages can give your civilization one of many instant benefits, like granting an additional [ICON_Citizen] Population in your city, or awarding [ICON_Gold] Gold. It is a good strategy to explore as many Tribal Villages as possible.
MOVE WARRIOR
To explore a Tribal Village, move one of your units into the Tribal Village hex. Try moving your Warrior unit there now.
It appears that the Tribal Villagers are also harassed by the Barbarians. They are impressed by our culture, and have decided to join us in the fight!

Good news indeed! They are skillful Scouts and wily travelers. They can move faster than our Warriors, making them ideal for exploring the surrounding lands, but they are not as strong in combat. They eagerly await your orders.
Notice that the Scout unit has a [ICON_Movement] Movement of 3, allowing it to move a greater distance than other units. Move the Scout unit toward an undiscovered part of the map.
Scouts are excellent at exploring, but they are not as strong in combat as our Warriors. It is better to have them focus on exploration and survival rather than fighting our enemies.

A team of Builders has finished their training in our city. They are ready to work on improving the surrounding lands. There are ideal locations for the growing of [ICON_Food] Food to support our populace. Constructing a Farm there would increase our yield from those lands.

Builders can construct a wide variety of improvements to your land. The type of improvement they can build on a plot is often determined by the type of terrain. Plains and Grassland plots are ideal for Farms, which help increase [ICON_Citizen] Population.
MOVE BUILDER
Move your Builder to the highlighted Plains area next to your city.
CONSTRUCT FARM
Construct a Farm improvement here by clicking on the "Build Improvement: Farm" button next to the Unit Panel.

Constructing a Farm here has increased the [ICON_Food] Food yield from this plot from 1 [ICON_Food] Food per turn to 2. The amount of [ICON_Food] Food generated by your city determines how fast the Population of that city grows, granting you new [ICON_Citizen] Citizens to work more tiles. More [ICON_Food] Food means faster growth.

Builders can build up to 3 improvements before exhausting their workforce. This number is indicated in the Unit Panel. This Builder unit has consumed one of its workforce from building the Farm and now has 2 remaining.

Your Majesty, it is once again time to choose where to direct the production efforts of our city. Your leadership is without equal and our civilization continues to thrive. Shall we construct a Monument to honor our civilization's growing greatness?
There are no more pressing issues at this time. Shall we continue with our duties?
Our explorers on the frontier have discovered a Barbarian camp. This is the source of the Barbarians threatening our region. We must destroy this stronghold, or they will continue to plague us.
I would advise you to use caution. The Barbarian camp is heavily defended by their best troops and will be hard to take. We should send an assault force of multiple military units to ensure victory.
In developing your military, it is always a good strategy to diversify. Not all units are created equal, some are better against others, and have abilities that separate them from the rest.
In developing your military, it is always a good strategy to diversify. Not all units are created equal, some are better against others, and have abilities that separate them from the rest.
Our explorers have spotted another friendly Tribal Village. I suggest we send our Scouts to investigate it.
A good city can become a great city through careful planning. Deciding where to place a city district is an important decision. Be sure to pick a location best suited to reap the most benefit.
Your Excellency, I am happy to announce that because of our city's prosperity, our [ICON_Citizen] Population has grown!

The [ICON_Citizen] Population of your first city has grown from 1 to 2. As long as a city is well fed and its people are happy, it will continue to grow. The [ICON_Citizen] Citizens of the city work the surrounding plots and improvements contributing to greater yields. Higher [ICON_Citizen] Populations contribute to faster [ICON_Science] Science research, faster city [ICON_Production] Production, and faster [ICON_Culture] Cultural growth.

The [ICON_Citizen] Population of your first city has grown from 1 to 2. As long as a city is well fed and its people are happy, it will continue to grow. The [ICON_Citizen] Citizens of the city work the surrounding plots and improvements contributing to greater yields. Higher [ICON_Citizen] Populations contribute to faster [ICON_Science] Science research, faster city [ICON_Production] Production, and faster [ICON_Culture] Cultural growth.
It is always a good strategy to not only found new cities to expand your realm, but also to grow those cities.
It is always a good strategy to not only found new cities to expand your realm, but also to grow those cities.

In Civilization VI, you can get Eureka Moments that boost your technology research through in game achievements. This Eureka Moment was gained by discovering a natural wonder. Other achievements could be winning a battle with a specific unit or constructing a building. Achieving these greatly accelerates your technological progress.
Through exploration we have discovered a natural wonder of the world. There is no doubt that it could provide a great benefit to the one who settles the lands surrounding it.
Reconnaissance units like Scouts are unique in that they can gain experience by exploring and discovering parts of the world.
The workforce of our Builder unit has been expended. We will need to train more Builders to continue building improvements on the lands surrounding our cities.
Enacting new policies in our government can be of great benefit. Our people await your decree.
The opportunity has arrived for a change into a new and more powerful system of government. Let us strengthen our identity and enact more policies to govern our people.
We have the opportunity to develop a formal Trade Route between two cities. A Trader unit is required to establish such a route, which would be very beneficial for our economy.

In addition to bringing riches to our civilization, this Trade Route will gradually develop Roads between our cities. Roads allow our units to no longer be impaired by the difficult terrain through which they pass.
This military unit has proven themselves. From the experience they have gained in combat they are eligible to be granted a promotion. How will you award these brave souls?
The combat achievements of this unit have become legendary, and worthy of a name unique to them. With what title shall we honor them?
The health of this unit is very low and in danger of being lost. Allowing a unit to take a break from combat and rest will allow it to heal over time.
It is best to use caution when moving close to enemy units. Doing so will often force the unit to be in the enemy's 'zone of control', restricting its movement.
My liege, our city would do well with some farms or other improvements. I suggest we train a Builder soon.
Our Builders have been idle. Perhaps we should direct their efforts to improving the lands around our city.
Our capital flourishes! But I think it is time that we begin establishing roots elsewhere. Perhaps we should train a Settler.
My liege, we have an Envoy at our disposal. We can use the Envoy to gain favor with a city-state. Becoming friendly with a city-state neighbor can be greatly beneficial to our civilization.
Our City-State neighbors have made a request of us. If we can impress them, I think they will reward us handsomely.
I'm afraid I must report that we are bankrupt. It is imperative that we do whatever we can to ease ourselves of this debt. May I suggest we disband some of our military?
Your grace, I must warn you that some of the improved lands around our city have been pillaged. We should find those responsible and ensure no more damage can be done.
We have recently gained advanced knowledge in city planning. Creating districts in our cities can be much more powerful and lucrative than simple improvements like Farms and Mines.
Our military has learned the way of combining two military units into larger scale Corps. These Corps units are much more powerful than their singular counterparts.
Our military now is trained in the way of combining three military units into a single Army, much larger and more powerful than a Corps unit.

Your Grace, we have obtained greater knowledge in the art of building static fortifications. Building Walls around our cities will not only make them stronger against a foreign invader, but will also allow them to bombard nearby enemies.

Your grace! The enemy is at our gates, and this city is surrounded and under siege. Supplies and food cannot get through, and our city cannot heal its wounds. It is paramount that we break this encirclement.
An enemy is in range of our city. Order the city garrison to conduct a ranged attack against the invaders.
It is important to keep a close eye on our neighbors, and our people may be able to help. Listen carefully, for they are sometimes privy to more information than we are.
My liege, we are beginning to attract the attention of the Great People of the world. Of course, there are other leaders vying for their attention, too.
The more specialized districts we construct, the more we will draw in specialized Great People to share their talents with our civilization. I advise that we continue to build these.
A famous artist is inspired by our civilization, and has come to our lands to create great works of art. I suggest we find somewhere to house these masterpieces immediately.
This writer has been inspired by our civilization, and comes to our lands to create great works of writing. I suggest we find somewhere to house these masterpieces immediately.
Our populace has attracted a Great Prophet to our lands! Send this most holy person to our Holy Site and rejoice, for the time has come to found a religion for ourselves.
This musician is inspired by our civilization, and has come to our land to create great musical works. I suggest we find somewhere to house these masterpieces immediately.

Our civilization's attention to the naval arm of our military has given rise to a Great Admiral among our ranks. When deployed wisely among our ships we are sure to have a distinct advantage in battle.
Our civilization's dedication to military affairs has given rise to a Great General among our troops. When used wisely in the field, generals can change the tide of battle in our favor.
A great merchant has come to our civilization! Each one has a unique talent which will help our economy flourish.
Our dedication to the ways of science has attracted a great scientist to our civilization! I am certain we will be able to use them to benefit future scientific developments.

Constructing wonders of the world not only is a remarkable display of our empire's greatness, they have other benefits as well. Remember, other civilizations may also be competing in this endeavor, and there can only be one of each type in the world.

Just as our citizens have faith in your leadership, so they are beginning to have faith in a higher power. I think it is wise to cultivate this new way of thinking - perhaps there is some benefit to be gained.
The number of faithful has grown, and it is time for us to define our beliefs. Let us choose a pantheon to worship.
My liege, we have the ability to train religious missionaries to begin spreading our great religion to foreign lands.
Your majesty, I believe that we may benefit from recruiting an apostle to spread our religion. These holy people are quite powerful in the ways of conversion.
All other religions in the world are a threat to our faith. We can recruit Inquisitors to purge the heretics from our cities.
Your Excellency, I feel it is time to build some Neighborhoods for our growing populous. We should build these on our most beautiful lands - near natural wonders, or perhaps by the Coast.
My liege, all of our military has been destroyed and we are completely defenseless. Training military units is of utmost importance if we are to survive.
Our explorers have spotted another friendly Tribal Village. I suggest we send a Scout to investigate.
Your Majesty, keep your allies close and your enemies closer. We are now able to recruit a Spy who could help us better understand what it is that our neighbors do… On a more covert level.
Some resources, like this one, can be harvested. This will remove the resource in exchange for an immediate gain. But once it is removed, it will not come back.
We have discovered a City-State! Establishing diplomatic relations with them will surely be beneficial for our empire. Perhaps we should send them an envoy…

There are several different types of City-States, and each may provide different benefits in return for our friendship. Our government, over time, will allow us to earn envoys to grow these relationships.
We have trained our first ranged unit, capable of hitting enemies from afar, while out of the range of hand-to-hand combat.
A siege unit! This will surely be useful if we choose to engage in a city attack.

We are now skilled in the construction of walls to protect our cities. In addition to providing protection from invaders, they are also excellent vantage points to bombard enemies with ranged attacks.
The enemy has surrounded the city and we are under siege. We must break this blockade or we will not be able to reinforce the garrison and repair our defenses.
My liege, this city has great defenses. With enough force, and the right military, I think we can take it.
Your majesty, there are times when peace is not the better option. I think we now have good reason to show our military might, but it is a careful decision that you must make alone.
It is a difficult world to face alone, but if I may, I do believe that one of our neighbors has proven worthy. Shall we extend the hand of friendship to them?

Your excellency, I feel it is time that we send a diplomatic delegation to those around us. This will allow us to sow the seeds of friendship, and perhaps give us a better insight as to what these other people may be doing.
I have good news! If we wish it, I think we may have an ally amongst our neighbors. This could come in handy if we ever find ourselves in need of help.
Do not distress, my liege. There are those out there who cannot be pleased, no matter what. It is important to remember what you stand for, and if the time comes… to fight for it.
My liege, I must warn you that denouncing other civilizations will have long and lasting consequences. It is important to think carefully on these matters.
Though it appears as if we may have offended someone, do not fret. There will always be other leaders with different ideas than our own.
It seems that our choices have won favor with one of our neighbors. But everyone has their own agenda, and I am sure that someone else may be watching us warily.
Your grace, If I may, I think it is time that we begin exploring what is beyond our shores. It may be that our land units would be fit for this opportunity.
It isn't just our lands that can be improved, but our waterways as well. I suggest we search for opportunities to exploit the resources along the shores.
I think we may have an opportunity to convince the followers of another religion of the error of their ways. Shall we seize this opportunity?
Foreign proselytizers have been seeking audience with our citizens. I must advise that we do something about this threat to our holy lands. Perhaps we should launch an inquisition.
Neighborhoods with higher appeal will house more citizens, whereas neighborhoods built by marsh, airports, or rainforest are not going to be very populated at all.
Our treasury is filled with gold, and I think it could be wise to make an investment. Perhaps we could expand our military.
We have not yet constructed a Holy Site, and the great prophet that we have attracted to our city has nowhere to go. Let's construct one!
Our populace has attracted a Great Prophet to our lands! Send this most holy person to Stonehenge and rejoice, for the time has come to found a religion for ourselves.
A Great Engineer has come to our civilization, ready to work hard to advance our infrastructure. Each has a different talent, but all of them can improve our cities in some way.
We now have the ability to build a Spaceport. If we further our research, we may be able to unlock the mysteries of the stars.
We have uncovered a way to increase our farming output. To tap into this potential, I suggest we try to maintain two adjacent farms to each plot of farmland.
We have furthered our agricultural technology yet again! Each farm that we build next to another will increase the output of both - I suggest we do this as often as possible.
Times have changed, and the era of diplomatic delegations has passed. It is important that we now establish Embassies with our friends and allies.
This earth is a gift, and it is important that we protect it. I recommend we establish a National Park. It may even attract tourists!
It isn't simply seagulls that flock to our shores now. If we build a Seaside Resort, we may be able to benefit from this new attraction to the ocean.
Though our own people are quite skilled, we can always benefit by learning from others. Perhaps we should look into beginning a Research Agreement with one of our neighbors.
A Relic! If we can house this for our people to see, I am certain that it will attract more of the faithful to our lands.
It appears we have become quite a popular attraction to the people of the world. I wonder how many more tourists will travel through our borders…
You are a brave and mighty conqueror! I have great faith that you will soon rule all of the lands before us.
Our religion spreads throughout the lands. It is a great joy to see so many people embracing what we know to be true. Though, there are still more who have yet to see the light.
Though our population grows, there is little room for our newest citizens. We should find a way to add more housing to this city.
Your grace, I worry about the happiness of our citizens. I would advise that we investigate a means of increasing their contentment.

Our people have discovered that they have a particular, useful skill that I think we should explore. If we begin construction on this new district now, I believe we will have it completed in no time at all.
Alas, all of this time that we spend at war is taking a toll on our people. I see pain in their eyes, and our productivity has reached record lows.
The building of an Archeological Museum will allow us to train Archeologists. There is so much to learn from the world, and they will help us gain this knowledge.
SELECT SETTLER
Click on the Settler unit to select it.
END TURN
Since there are no more decisions to make this turn, click the Next Turn button to continue.

Tasks which must be completed before you can end your turn will appear in the notification panel in the bottom right of the screen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Since production has finished in this city, you get a reminder that you need to choose the next thing to produce before you can end your turn.
REQUIRED ACTIONS
Click the Choose Production notification to select your next production task.
REQUIRED ACTIONS
Research must be selected before the turn can be completed.

A Builder unit has been added to the city's Production Queue. It will take several turns to complete its training. Since there are no remaining decisions that need to be made this turn, the Next Turn button is displayed.
END TURN
Click the Next Turn button to continue.
END TURN

Since your Warrior unit has used all of its [ICON_Movement] Movement points, it is done with its actions this turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Production and research tasks are still in progress, so there are no other decisions to be made.
Click the Next Turn button once again to continue.
SELECT WARRIOR
Click on the Warrior unit to select it.
FOUND A CITY
Click the Found City button to order your Settler to found a new city at this location.
CHOOSE PRODUCTION
Open the Production Chooser of this city by clicking the Change City Production button.
PRODUCTION CHOOSER
This is the city's Production Chooser. From here you can construct buildings, create wonders of the world, and train military and civilian units.
Select the Warrior button to start training a Warrior unit in your city.

Civilization is a turn-based game where decisions are made and actions performed during a game turn, much like playing a board game with friends. Once all the other players have made their moves, a new turn will begin.

Building items in your city takes time. The number of game turns it will take is indicated on each item in the menu.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is calculated based on the [ICON_Production] Production cost of the item versus the [ICON_Production] Production yield of the city. The higher the yield, the fewer turns it will take to build.
END TURN
Click the Next Turn button to finish your turn.
The Research Panel displays what technology your civilization is currently working toward. It is empty because you have not yet chosen a technology to research.
SELECT RESEARCH
Select the Mining technology from the menu to begin researching it.
MOVE WARRIOR
Military units can attack enemy units by moving into their hex. Right-click on the Barbarian unit to attack it. Try doing that now.
BUILD MONUMENT
In addition to training units, your city can focus its production on constructing buildings like the Monument.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Try building one now by selecting it in the city's Production Queue.
With Barbarians in our midst, I think our people would be more comfortable if our Warriors were closer to the city. Order them to return and defend.
Units can be ordered to move longer distances by giving them a multi-turn order. This will eliminate the need to give a separate move order every turn to reach a destination.
MOVE WARRIOR
Try ordering the Warrior to return to the city by clicking the Move To button, then clicking the city.
When using a multi-move order, a path will display on the map indicating the path the unit will take, along with indicators of the number of turns until it reaches the destination.
Your Majesty, our Scouts are eager to explore the surrounding lands and uncover new areas of the continent. Send them forth!
There are no further matters to attend to at present, My Liege.

Our brightest minds have discovered new and ingenious ways to extract precious stones and metals from the earth. There is an abundance of valuable Stone nearby, it would be wise to send our Builders to construct a Quarry there.

Scattered around the map are resources of various kinds. There are 3 categories of resources:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Luxury: These contribute to the overall happiness of your citizens.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Strategic: Essential for creating some very powerful military units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Bonus: Provide additional yields of [ICON_Food] Food , [ICON_Production] Production, or [ICON_Gold] Gold.
BUILD QUARRY

This Stone is a Bonus resource. It provides an additional +1 [ICON_Production]Production to your city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you build a Quarry improvement here, it will raise the yield to +2 [ICON_Production]Production.
Move your Builder unit to the Stone resource and have them construct a Quarry improvement there.

Quarry improvements increase the [ICON_Production]Production of the city they're in. Higher Production allows units and buildings to be constructed faster. In short, the higher the Production of a city, the less turns required to build something there.
Our citizens are comforted by the return of our Warriors to the city. Might I suggest having them adopt a more defensive stance for the time being? They will be vigilant against the Barbarian threat.

Great news! Our craftsmen have completed the Monument in our city! It is a symbol of the accomplishments and perseverance of our civilization, and inspires our people to push even further into the lands beyond.

Your Majesty, we should expand our realm. We have adventurous families ready to strike out and claim new lands for the glory of our people. If we do not expand our borders, then in time we will find ourselves surrounded by our enemies.
Settlers will take some time to complete their training. Our Scout should continue exploring undiscovered lands. I would advise we keep our Warriors in the [ICON_Capital] Capital to defend it.

The Settlers are ready to embark on their journey to found a new city and expand our civilization. The lands beyond are dangerous, and it would be wise to insure their protection by sending them with a military escort.

Our Settlers should be safe on their journey under the protection of our Warriors. But we will be without protection in the [ICON_Capital] Capital once they leave. I suggest we begin training a Slinger unit immediately to defend the city.
Well done, Your Majesty. Our great minds have already begun work on new ways to store and preserve our food.
May the triumphs of our great civilization know no bounds! Our second great city awaits your direction. With your wise leadership it too shall grow and thrive.
Like our [ICON_Capital] Capital, this city can produce buildings and units, increase its population, and expand its borders. More cities means more to manage, but I have great faith in Your Majesty.
Your Majesty has shown wisdom and understanding in the fundamentals of ruling a civilization. I shall be available to assist you at any point should you wish, but for now I take my leave.
Our farmers are very skilled at providing [ICON_Food] Food for our people, but we need to find better ways to store it. I suggest we direct the efforts of our scientists to solving this problem.

Our dedication to developing a consistent written language has allowed us to record our knowledge for future use. If we were to provide a common location in our city for our scientists to share this information I'm sure their pursuits would be much more efficient.
Excellent! Construction on a Campus has begun. Our scientists look forward to its completion.
The Campus is complete and we have already begun to see its benefits. Construction of a Library would be ideal at such a location, should your highness agree to it.
It seems we are not the only people competing for control of these lands. I suggest we proceed with caution.
Your Highness we are at war. Security of the realm is of greatest importance. We must begin mobilizing an army immediately.
Uniting your governance with a strict code of laws can be most beneficial to us. I think it is time to enact a set of policies to strengthen our progress toward a more refined civilization.

Strict discipline in our military ranks would give us an edge against the unorganized Barbarian horde. More structured Urban Planning will make our cities more organized and efficient. I suggest we enact these policies.
Nurturing our populace is important, but we must also protect them. There are barbaric tribes near us who want nothing more than to pillage and plunder what is ours.
We continue to make progress on training a team of Builders, and research is continuing as planned. [NEWLINE] Our Warriors are very close to the Tribal Village and should arrive soon.
Our people have looked to the heavens, and begun to wonder if our fortunes may be guided by the hands of a greater power. Who are these great gods, and what blessings might they bestow on us?

In a life dedicated to searching for guidance in the mysteries of the universe, one has had an epiphany that will guide our faithful for millennia to come. Let the teachings of this Great Prophet spread people of all cultures across the face of the earth. By proliferating our Religion, we may be victorious over our rivals.
Congratulations, My Liege! Your leadership has inspired our people to greatness, and now one among them has attained true genius. Their contribution will reverberate throughout history.
Your Majesty, we must reach out to our neighbors in trade. Through them, we stand to boost our economy, and gain new insights into the mysteries of the world.

My Liege, we have made contact with some outsiders. These people are more advanced than the Tribal Villagers that have aided us in the past. Should we extend a hand in friendship, or seek to conquer them?
Caution, your majesty. This city is hostile to us and its people will surely fight to the bitter end to keep it out of our hands. We must be well prepared
SELECT RESEARCH
SELECT RESEARCH
Click the Choose Research button to display the research chooser.
CHANGE RESEARCH
Select the Pottery technology from the Research Menu.
NOTIFICATIONS

If there are units that have not moved this turn and are awaiting orders, you can address them by clicking the Unit Needs Orders notification. Click the notification now to be taken to your Scout unit so you may issue new orders.
MOVE SCOUT
Continue to explore the world with your Scout unit.

When not advancing a military unit, it is often a good idea to fortify the unit. When ordered to fortify, the unit will spend up to 2 turns digging in. This will increase their [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if they are attacked.
FORTIFY WARRIOR
Try ordering the Warrior unit to do so by clicking on the Fortify button.
FORTIFY BONUS

This unit will now have an advantage in combat when defending. However, if the unit is moved it will lose its fortified status and will have to be ordered to fortify again in order to receive the bonus.
BUILDER WORKFORCE

Your Builder still has one of its workforce remaining.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You can use it to build either a Mine on the Hill plot (+[ICON_Production] Production), or a Farm on the Plains plot (+[ICON_Food] Food).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This may take more than one turn, one to move the Builder unit, and another turn to build the improvement.

Remember: Builders can only construct improvements within the borders of your city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]By generating [ICON_Culture] Culture, the borders of your city will expand, allowing you access to more resources.
EXPLORATION
Feel free to continue exploring the map with your Scout unit. End your turn when you have finished giving orders to your Builder and Scout.

Your city has finished production on the Monument building. All buildings contribute to a city’s development in specific ways. The Monument will increase the [ICON_Culture] Culture generated by the city, which extends the city’s influence over additional hexes.
TRAIN SETTLERS
Begin training a Settler unit.

Open the Production Chooser and begin training a Settler unit. Remember, the Production Chooser can either be accessed from the city's Information Panel or from the Choose Production reminder in the Notification Panel on the right side of the game view.

Units like Settlers and Builders are non-combat, civilian units and thus cannot defend themselves. This leaves them highly vulnerable to be captured or killed by enemy units. However, your military units can act as protection for the civilian unit if they occupy the same hex.
An easy way to move the two units together is by linking them together until they reach their destination.
ESCORT SETTLER
Select either the Settler or the Warrior and click the Escort button in the unit panel.
MOVE FORMATION
Begin moving the units southeast toward the indicated map marker. If you have not yet revealed that part of the map it might make your journey easier if you sent your Scout there as well.

In a game of Civilization, once a player loses all of their cities, the game is over. It is very important that you protect your cities, especially your [ICON_Capital] Capital, from any foreign threat.
TRAIN SLINGERS
Add a Slinger unit to the city's Production Queue and end your turn when you are finished.

As is often the case in history, technological discoveries inspire new technologies, building upon knowledge gained in the past. In a game of Civilization, this is simulated by the Technology Tree. Click the open Technology Tree button in the Research Panel to view it.
Open Technology Tree
Click to open the Technology Tree
The Technology Tree displays all of the researchable technologies available in a game of Civilization, from the Ancient era all the way to the Information era and beyond.
The gold colored nodes represent technologies that you have already finished researching. You have just finished researching Pottery, so it has been marked as complete.
The dark grey nodes represent technologies that are available to begin researching, but are not complete.
Light grey nodes represent technologies that are not yet available to begin researching. These technologies need to first be unlocked by researching one or more prerequisite technologies.
Since we have already researched Pottery, we are now able to begin research on the Writing technology.
SELECT RESEARCH
Start research on Writing by clicking on the Writing node in the Technology Tree.

Notice the Writing technology node status has changed, indicating that it is currently being researched. The number of turns required to finish research on a technology is indicated in the upper right corner of the node.
The symbols displayed inside the technology node represent new units, buildings, wonders and abilities that are unlocked by the technology once it is completed.

For example, once you have finished researching the Writing technology, you will be able to construct the Campus district as well as the Library building in all of your cities. The Campus and Library allow you to increase the amount of [ICON_Science] Science you generate each turn, allowing you to research technologies faster!
Since you're done designating new research, we can close the Technology Tree by clicking the X button in the upper right corner.
Close Tree
Click to close the Technology Tree
Continue moving your Settler unit to the indicated location.

In choosing a location to settle a new city, it is important to look at the fertility of the surrounding land. Proximity to sources of [ICON_Food] Food, resources, and fresh water are all very important. For this tutorial we have already found an ideal location for you.
When your Settler unit is able, click the Found City button to create a new city here. This may require moving on to the next turn if your Settler is out of [ICON_Movement] Movement points.

To win a game of Civilization, as a player you need to defeat all other civilizations in the world. There are multiple ways to achieve this. You can conquer their cities militarily, bringing them into your civilization. You can also win technologically, or through cultural or religious dominance.

On the path to victory, there are fundamental strategies to assist you in building your civilization.[NEWLINE]---[NEWLINE]For this tutorial, we have provided four goals for you to achieve. Complete all four and you can complete the tutorial. However, in order to WIN the tutorial, you need to complete the fifth goal.

Congratulations![NEWLINE]---[NEWLINE]You have completed the fundamentals of growing and maintaining a civilization that will stand the test of time. You can finish the tutorial, or you can keep playing and win this game by eliminating the rival civ.

In this tutorial you are playing on a small map with a single rival civilization. A standard game of Civilization presents a larger map of the world, with several rival civilizations, all competing to win. The task is larger, but the goals remain the same.
To win this game, you must conquer all the rival civilization’s city(s) with your military.[NEWLINE]---[NEWLINE]Good luck!
Open the Production Chooser of your first city by clicking the production button on the City Banner.
In Civilization VI, there are many types of districts that can be built in your cities, each with a specific purpose.

By completing research on Writing, you are now able to construct a Campus district in your city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Campus district is dedicated to increasing the amount of [ICON_Science] Science generated by the city that contains it.
Many districts in the game also get a bonus depending on where they are placed within the city. The Campus gets a bonus when built next to Mountains or Jungles.
BUILD CAMPUS
Click the Campus button in the Production Chooser to start building one in this city.
When placing a district, the map changes slightly to indicate ideal locations in which to build it.
This plot has Mountains on two of its edges, each providing +1 [ICON_Science] Science per turn. Placing the Campus here would be ideal.
Click this hex to begin building a Campus here.
Since you have finished the Writing technology, you now must choose what to research next. If you would like a suggestion, Animal Husbandry and Bronze Working are both good choices.

Animal Husbandry will allow you to build the Pasture and Camp improvements in your cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Bronze Working will help you militarily by unlocking the Encampment district, as well as allow you to train Spearmen.

Some buildings can only be constructed in districts. The Library is a building exclusive to the Campus district. Since we have completed construction on the Campus, we are now able to build a Library on it.
BUILD LIBRARY
Click the Choose Production button in the lower right to begin building a Library.

Congratulations!![NEWLINE]You have won your first game of Civilization.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You are now ready to take on much larger challenges and objectives, explore new worlds, meet new civilizations for the first time, and achieve victory on your terms.
When engaged in a war with another civilization, it is best to have a sufficient number of combat units, both to defend your cities as well as fight abroad.

Sometimes it is necessary to suspend production on a building or district in order to train units to fight the war. To do this, simply change the current production task of the city to the combat unit you wish to create.
When you are satisfied with the size of your military, you can resume production on what was being built previously without losing the progress you made on it.

Engaging in diplomatic relations with other civilizations can be very lucrative. Of course, relations can also go sour. How you interact with other leaders is your choice. Just remember, in the path to victory, you cannot always be everyone’s friend.
By accumulating [ICON_Culture] Culture, you have just unlocked Code of Laws, which contains your first government: Chiefdom.
GOVERNMENT
To access it, click the Government button.
There are many types of governments in Civilization VI. In addition to various benefits, each government has a number of slots in which you can enact policies.
The first government available to you is a Chiefdom. It has 2 available slots for policies. The first slot in Chiefdom is for Military policies. The second is for Economic policies.
GOVERNMENT POLICIES
Click the Change Policies button

To slot a policy, click and drag the policy from the right to the appropriate slot in your government on the left.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Try that now by adding the Discipline policy to the Military slot, then add the Urban Planning policy to the Economic slot. Click the Confirm Policies button when you are done.

By enacting these policies, your military units will now get a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus when fighting against Barbarians. Also, your cities receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production per turn, allowing them to train units and construct buildings faster than before.

Much in the same way you research new technologies by generating [ICON_Science] Science in your cities, you unlock civics by generating [ICON_Culture] Culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You have already unlocked the Code of Laws civic which enabled you to establish your first government.
Now you need to select a new civic to advance toward.

The city is the cornerstone of any great civilization. A city’s size is represented by its [ICON_Citizen] Population, indicated to the left of its nameplate.

A Slinger unit has finished training in your capital. Slingers are ranged class units, allowing them to attack from distance without engaging in melee combat. This keeps them from taking reciprocal damage during the attack.

Each city also claims the surrounding lands for your exclusive control. These lands are indicated by the colored border surrounding the city. The unique features within your borders will have a profound influence on the potential strengths of each city.
Ranged units also tend to have lower defense strength than their melee fighting counterparts, so it is best to keep them close to friendly units of other types for protection.
You must choose how each city in your civilization is to grow and expand over time, improving the land you control and creating new buildings and districts within your borders.

As you progress through the game and research new technologies, you will unlock better, stronger, and more advanced units. Building a strong and diverse fighting force is essential in competing against other civilizations, and preserving the safety of your people.
We have just completed research on Writing.

In addition to [ICON_Food] Food, your people also require [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in their cities. One source of [ICON_Amenities] Amenities are Luxury resources, such as this [ICON_Resource_Coffee] Coffee next to your [ICON_Capital] Capital. With the Pottery technology complete, it would be a good idea to research Irrigation to enable your Builders to improve Luxury resources, such as the [ICON_Resource_Coffee] Coffee next to our [ICON_Capital] Capital. This will provide [ICON_Amenities] Amenities to our city, increasing its happiness.

Each city generates a variety of yields at the start of every turn. These are obtained from the hexes that the city controls.

Each hex within your city borders can provide a number of yields to help you advance your civilization. [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Production] Production are two of these yields.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [ICON_Food] Food fuels city growth, increasing its [ICON_Citizen] Population. More [ICON_Food] Food, faster growth.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [ICON_Production] Production is used to build new items, like military units and city upgrades. The more [ICON_Production] Production your city has, the faster you can build things.
However, each hex will need to be worked by your [ICON_Citizen] Population in order to obtain the yield from that hex.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each [ICON_Citizen] Citizen can work 1 hex within your borders.
Growing your city’s [ICON_Citizen] Population is very important in order to take advantage of all the yields from the surrounding lands.

It is now up to you to decide what you would like to produce in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Suggestions:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- Train a Builder to improve more of the surrounding lands within your borders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]- Train a combat unit to expand the size and strength of your military.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]-Build a Granary to provide additional [ICON_Food] Food for your city as well as more [ICON_Housing] Housing for your [ICON_Citizen] Population.

The symbols displayed inside the technology node represent new units, buildings, wonders, and abilities that are unlocked by the technology once it is completed. For example, once you have finished researching the Pottery technology, you will be able to construct the Granary building in all of your cities. Your Builders will also gain the ability to harvest Wheat resources near your city. The technological advancement of your people is attained through research.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]By completing research on technologies you will unlock new ways to exploit the land, new military units, new city upgrades, and much more.
Just as building new units is fueled by [ICON_Production] Production, researching new technologies is fueled by [ICON_Science] Science.

Each city in your empire generates a small amount of [ICON_Science] Science per turn. How quickly your research projects are completed is determined by the total of all the [ICON_Science] Science generated by your cities. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The more [ICON_Science] Science you generate, the faster you research new technologies.

To win a game of Civilization, you need to defeat all other civilizations in the world. There are multiple ways to achieve this. Most games will also end in the year 2050 or after a set number of turns. If no player has achieved these Victories by then, score will determine the winner. Score is calculated as a general measure of each player’s achievements in all fields of endeavor.
The status of each Victory’s conditions are tracked on the World Rankings panel. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Open it now.
World Rankings
Click to open the World Rankings panel
The Overall tab gives you an overview of all types of Victory and your ranking against other players
The other tabs give you more specific detail about each set of rankings. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Close the panel when you are ready to proceed.

The rest of this tutorial will help you to achieve your first Domination Victory.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The goal of a Domination Victory is for your civilization to be the last to occupy its own [ICON_Capital] Capital city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For this tutorial, that means you will have to use your military to capture the [ICON_Capital] Capital city of your rival, while preventing them from taking yours.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How you ultimately achieve this will be up to you. However, we have provided three optional objectives that, if completed, will greatly assist you in achieving this.
If you are unsure about something, or are looking for more information about anything you’ve seen in this tutorial, there’s a good chance you’ll find it in the Civilopedia.
Districts are specific areas of your city dedicated to providing a specific yield. Buildings can be constructed in districts to increase that yield while also providing other benefits for your city.

For example, you have unlocked the {DISTRICT_TYPE} district which is dedicated to providing {YIELD_TYPE} to your civilization. Constructing a {DISTRICT_BUILDING} building in this district increases the {YIELD_TYPE} yield for your civilization.

To zone a district, select it in your city’s production menu as you would a building or a unit. Some districts have rules of where they can be placed, but even more important is that districts can have an even greater benefit if placed in an optimal location.

When you are ready to zone a district, the game will assist you in choosing the best location. Sometimes you might not have a valid spot in your city to place a new district right away. The location may have to be cleared of obstructions, or all of your existing city plots may already have improvements.
Expanding the size of your city is one way to gain more locations for districts, as well as improvements.

Your Majesty, if I may… Although our scientists would be willing to explore other topics of research, I feel it is best to not distract them until they have completed their current project unless absolutely necessary.

Any research progress on a technology is not lost, so there are cases where changing your research focus is strategically valid. However, it is always better to have a completed technology rather than many incomplete ones.

In Civilization VI, you can get Eureka Moments that boost your technology research through in game achievements. This Eureka Moment was gained by discovering a natural wonder. Other achievements could be winning a battle with a specific unit or constructing a building. Achieving these greatly accelerates your technological progress.
Scouts are ideal for investigating Tribal Villages because they receive experience from it.

Any production progress on an item in the queue is not lost, so there are cases where changing your city’s production focus is strategically valid. However, it is often best to finish what you have started before starting something new.

You might have noticed that your Builder unit disappeared after using its last build ‘charge’. This is because all of its workforce has been expended. You will need to train more Builders as you progress through the game to improve the lands around your cities.
Scouts, unlike other military units, gain experience from exploring Tribal Villages. They can also gain experience from discovering natural wonders in the world.

You may have noticed that your cities have been generating a small amount of [ICON_Faith] Faith each turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Faith] Faith is earned over time by certain buildings, districts, and policies.
Now that you’ve earned enough [ICON_Faith] Faith, you are able to take the first step towards founding a Religion by forming a Pantheon, which will provide you with a choice of strategic benefits.
Choose Pantheon
Click the Religion button to open the Religion screen and choose a Pantheon.

There are many Pantheons to choose from with different gameplay effects. Once one is chosen by a player, it is removed from the list of available Pantheons and is exclusive to that player’s religion for the duration of the game. Choose wisely!
Choose a Pantheon, then click the 'Found this Pantheon' button when you are done.

Well done! The next step is to attract a Great Prophet, who will be able to found a Religion. But first, you will need to build a Holy Site district, or enact an appropriate government policy, both of which will earn you Great Prophet Points.

There are a limited number of opportunities to found a Religion. Doing so is optional, but keep in mind that if you do not, you may not have an effective counter against a player who is seeking a Religious Victory by converting your [ICON_Citizen] Citizens.
Close Religion

Your [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet has founded a new Religion, and you must customize it by selecting a name, symbol, and selecting two additional religious beliefs that will complement the Pantheon belief you selected previously.

Your new Religion can spread between cities, converting its [ICON_Citizen] Citizens into followers. It is possible for a city to have a mix of several Religions. The Religion with the majority of followers in a city will be the one that imparts its bonuses.

While Religion will slowly spread from city to city organically, you can cause sudden shifts by training Missionary and Apostle units and sending them out to spread your people’s Religion. These units can be obtained by spending [ICON_Faith] Faith to buy them in the Purchase tab of a city’s Production Menu.

Aggressively spreading your Religion is essential if you are targeting a Religious Victory. Even if you are not, it is wise to keep track of how Religion is spreading around the world. Counter it where possible to mitigate the chances of another player claiming Victory this way.

You have gained the opportunity to claim a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person for your civilization. [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People provide significant benefits to your civilization based on their field. There are many types of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People, including artists, engineers, and military leaders.
Great People
Open the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People panel to claim your [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person.
This is the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People panel. It shows all the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People that are currently available for civilizations to claim, their benefits, and their costs.

Each [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person has one or more opportunities to activate a special bonus. They will appear as a unit in one of your cities and you must Activate their bonus at a special location on the map. Once they have used all their bonuses, the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person will disappear.

A [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person is earned by saving up enough [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People Points of its type, then spending them to recruit the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person to your civilization. These points come primarily from districts and buildings, but can also come from policies and other effects. If you are in a rush, you can spend [ICON_Gold] Gold or [ICON_Faith] Faith to instantly earn the [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person you want.

You can choose to pass on a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person that you don’t want. If you do this, then other players will have the opportunity to claim them, and your choice to pass is not reversible. However, your [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People Points will be saved for a future opportunity.
You’ve just completed a Trader unit. Traders travel between two cities and generate income for their city of origin.
Your civilization can establish a limited number of [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. You can expand this capacity with Commercial Hub or Harbor districts.
Assign Trade Route
Click the 'Assign Trade Route' unit action.
There are no other cities to trade with right now. Continue to explore the map, or build a Settler and found a new city of your own.

This is the Trade Panel, showing the cities that you can trade with currently. Traders have a limited range, but visiting nearby cities will establish a Trading Post there, allowing them to be used as a bridge to farther destinations.

Depending on the buildings and districts within a foreign destination, you stand to earn yields of [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith, [ICON_Culture] Culture, or [ICON_Gold] Gold each turn for a set number of turns. For domestic destinations, you can earn [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Production] Production.
Select the destination of your choice from the list of available cities.
Click 'Begin Route' to send this Trader on its way to the destination.
This Trader will now travel to the destination and back, generating the relevant yields each turn. Once it has returned, you can choose a new route.
The Trader will also build a Road between the cities as it goes. Units travelling a road generally suffer no terrain [ICON_Movement] Movement penalties.

You have discovered a nearby city-state. These are mini-civilizations that are similar in some ways to another player, but they can only ever have a single city and cannot win the game. By working with your city-state neighbors, you can build lucrative relationships and even gain their support in war.

You can also choose to forcefully assimilate their cities into your empire or raze them to the ground – but they are far more formidable than Barbarians to defeat, and you risk alienating their other allies.
Click the city-state button or click the city-state to open the city state panel.

This is the city-state panel. You can earn Envoys and dispatch them to a city-state. Doing this can earn you progressively better buffs to [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Production] Production, [ICON_Gold] Gold, or [ICON_Faith] Faith. Click the name of a city-state in the list.

These are the Quests you can complete for this city-state. This is one way to earn Envoys and improve your friendship with it. You can also earn Envoys by completing certain items in the Civics Tree, and over time through governments and policies.
Your unit is getting close to an enemy city. Attacking cities is usually a difficult and potentially costly undertaking that requires a mix of unit types and a tactical approach.
The city’s defense rating and health bar is shown on its Name Plate. This city has Walls. It will be able to launch a ranged attack from 2 hexes away, and will be highly resistant to melee units.

Certain siege units can improve your chances. Catapults can attack from range and do significant damage to Walls, while the Battering Ram or Siege Tower allows melee units to attack Walls or bypass them, respectively.

You have met the leader of another civilization. In Civilization VI, there will typically be several other civilizations sharing the world map with you. These are controlled by the game AI, and have all the same abilities – and ambitions – that you do.
As you play, you will need to consider how to deal with your neighbors and watch them carefully to improve your understanding of their strategy.
Leaders of civilizations you have met in the game will appear here. The leader icon on the far right represents your civilization. All other leaders will be listed to next to yours.
Leader Diplomacy
Click the other civilization leader's icon to access the Diplomacy view.
When you contact another leader, you can take a variety of actions, like exchanging goods, negotiating political treaties, making demands, or declaring war.
You can send a Delegation to improve your ties and expose more information about their [ICON_Capital] Capital city.

Denouncing a rival notifies all other civilizations that you have a bone to pick. This paves the way to war. If you do not make your feelings known, the war you declare will be a Surprise War, inflicting a lasting “Warmonger” reputation on you that may color future dealings with other leaders.

You can also negotiate deals with a leader. This can include trading commodities or political deals like Open Borders or Joint War. Alternatively, you can demand that they deal with you. This will sour your relationship, but they may acquiesce if they are weak or wish to avoid war.
What you know about this leader is summarized here. Be mindful of their Agendas. If you act in opposition to their Agendas, your relationship with them may sour and potentially lead to conflict.

Improving your Access Level to this civilization will expose more detailed information about them, and you’ll be notified when they take certain actions. It's a good idea to improve this as much as possible with the leaders you encounter, or you will be in the dark as to their strategy.

This section explains what the leader thinks about you, and why. If you wish to improve (or sour) your relationship, you’ll find some suggestions here. It may not be possible to avoid doing something that annoys them from time to time, so it can be useful to know how to balance the books.

Diplomacy will become increasingly important as you progress through history. Who your neighbors are and want they want will have a lasting impact on the development of your civilization – and will almost certainly present obstacles in your path to victory.
A City-State is a small civilization that cannot win the game. Establishing good diplomatic relations with them can be very lucrative. This is done by sending Envoys to the City State.

Trader units can be trained in one of your cities. In addition to providing additional [ICON_Gold] Gold and other benefits to your civilization, [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes are essential for building roads between cities.

While our forces prepare the defense of our city, our best minds have discovered how to extract precious resources from the earth itself. With an abundance of valuable Stone nearby, our Builders may be able to exploit this knowledge when they complete their training.
Our people delight in the pursuit of knowledge. We need only direct their efforts and they shall uncover yet another mystery of this world.
A wise decision. Our people may now uncover new uses for the materials we unearth in our Mines and Quarries.
But let us not forget the exploration efforts of our Scouts. There is a whole world before us to uncover.
As our Scouts continue to push onwards let us turn inwards to our own Capital. As our city grows, so too does our people's hunger...
Our Builders now stand ready. Constructing a Farm on fertile lands within our city will increase our yield and better feed our people.
These Plains possess rich soil. An ideal spot to plant our first crops...
Excellent. With their stomachs full our people prosper and our population shall only grow...
But remember, our Builders' strength is not infinite. We would be wise to make the best use of their talents before exhausting them.
With their basic needs met, our people now have the capability to construct more elaborate structures. Perhaps a Monument to all they have accomplished will inspire them to evolve even further...
Excellent, as pride in their own culture grows our people shall be driven to spread our civilization beyond their own borders.
And follow in the footsteps of our brave Scouts.
Now that our people are fed, let us turn our Builder's attention elsewhere. There are valuable resources surrounding our city that have yet to be exploited.
Direct the efforts of our Builders towards harnessing these valuable materials.
Excellent. This Stone we extract from this Quarry will only increase our production capabilities.
It would appear some of our people still require your direction...
With our Quarry now complete we must turn our Builders’ attention towards additional improvements.
There is still valuable land within our borders, we must guide their hands carefully.
Our people still await your command.
We are blessed. This Monument stands as symbol of the accomplishments and determination of our people. Truly they shall now be inspired to push even further into the lands beyond.
Perhaps we are now ready to spread our civilization beyond our Capital city. If we do not claim the surrounding territory, others surely will.
Excellent, these brave Settlers are ready to carry our culture into the unknown. However, it will take some time before they are prepared for the journey that awaits them.
There are reports of dangerous raiders roaming the lands nearby. It would be best to keep these Warriors here, seeing to the safety of our Capital.
Our Settlers have finished preparations and await your command. However, the lands before them possess untold dangers. We must not allow them to go forth without protection...
Excellent, with our people prepared we must now choose our destination.
There is an area rich in resources not far from the Capital. Let us send our Settlers there.
Though our Settlers are safe under the protection of our Warriors, our Capital is now defenseless. Without the protection of the military we will most surely become overrun by our enemies.
Though our Warriors are valiant a proper fighting force must be diversified. Slingers provide a different style of combat.
With knowledge comes opportunity. As our people's understanding of this world grows, new paths present themselves to us...
Location is critical in founding a new settlement. We are fortunate to have discovered such an ideal place.
Order our people to take root here.
Well done. Our civilization continues to spread beyond expectation. In time it may rival even our own Capital.
Already this new city yearns to grow. Its people await your guidance.
We have reports of another civilization growing on this continent. It seems we are not the only people competing for control of these lands.
It would seem we have finally tracked the Barbarian raiders plaguing these lands to their source. We must destroy this stronghold or risk future attacks.
Still might I advise caution. Though primitive and savage, these Barbarians are fierce warriors and their camp is heavily defended. To ensure victory we must attack with overwhelming force.
Our city continues to prosper. Already our people thrive and our population grows!
Although our scientists would be willing to explore other topics of research, perhaps it is not wise to distract them from their current work unless absolutely necessary.
The task at hand is of critical importance. Might I advise patience in this matter. We should allow our people to continue their work if at all possible.
We have spotted another friendly village nearby. Perhaps we should send a Scout to investigate.

A good city can become a great city through careful planning. Deciding where to place a city district is an important decision. Be sure to pick a location best suited for the district to reap the most benefit.
Our legacy will one day be recorded beyond the spoken word.
It appears our Slingers have completed their training. Already the people of our city feel safer...
As our army continues to diversify and improve, our future grows even more secure.
With our Slingers training complete, we may now direct our people's efforts to new pursuits.
Our people still await your command.

With Writing we unify our people. A common written language allows ideas to flourish and our collective knowledge to grow. Were we to provide a place to collect and share this knowledge our people would surely prosper...
By concentrating like minds and resources into districts we specialize the growth of our city. We must choose the location of these districts carefully in order to reap the most benefit.
Already the greatest minds in our civilization eagerly await the completion of this Campus...
But we must not allow these great thinkers to be idle. Let us turn their attention elsewhere...
Our greatest scholars and scientists already begin to gather at our Campus. Providing them with a Library would further assist them in their pursuits.
Our people have prospered under your guidance. Truly our civilization has no equal. Perhaps now is the time for you to prove this to be true.

The task before us is great, but under your leadership we shall not fail. As always I stand ready at your side should you require any assistance along the way. May our civilization truly stand forever.
We are victorious! You are now ready to take on bigger challenges, explore new worlds, meet new civilizations, and to achieve victory on your own terms.
Resources and land are not infinite. It seems we now have competition. As we do not yet know the true intention of this people, might I suggest we proceed with caution.
War is upon us! Our people are in danger. We must mobilize an army immediately or risk being conquered. There is no time for delay!
Our people truly thrive under your guidance. But as our civilization grows so too must our leadership.
We must now enact policies to better steer the growth of our people...

Discipline is the heart of any army and is a valuable advantage over the unorganized Barbarian rabble. Urban planning will only make our cities more organized and efficient. I suggest we enact both these policies.
Though our policies begin to bear fruit our civilization will only continue to grow. We must plan for the future...
Our people have looked to the heavens, and begun to wonder if our fortunes may be guided by the hands of a greater power. Who are these great gods, and what blessings might they bestow upon us?

Your inspiration is contagious. Though our civilization achieves greatness under your leadership, one amongst our people truly shines above all others. Under your guidance shall their impact truly reverberate throughout history.
Isolation is not the key to prosperity. These traders allow us to reach out to our neighbors. Through trade, we stand to boost our economy, and gain new insights into the mysteries of the world.
We have made contact with people more advanced than the Tribal Villagers who have aided us in the past. Should we extend the hand of friendship or look to conquer them?
The beauty and majesty of this world is sometimes enough to inspire our people to new directions of thought. This was a fortunate discovery...
Again our brave Scouts prove their worth to our people.
May I make a suggestion…
